intro: Hieracium cochlearioides subsp. tissierei, commonly known as the Tissier's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its rosette of basal leaves and a flowering head that produces yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has small, linear leaves and produces seeds in a disk-like structure surrounded by ray florets. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and localized species.
